ygData.subject: RE: [rest-discuss] The "new media types are evil" meme

On Tuesday, January 10, 2012 9:52 AM, mike amundsen wrote:
> The semantic d=
etails are spelled out in human-readable formz9in
> some external Out-of-ba=
nd document) and it is up to the developer
> to code this human-readable in=
formation into the client before
> releasing the client "into the wild". Th=
e response message contains
> no templates/forms, no indications of transcl=
usion, safety, or 
> idempotency; that information is always in the documen=
tation alone.=A0

That is exactly how I understand HAL as well. And since a=
ll of this is not
machine-readable at all the only real option is to hardco=
de those "rel"
values into the client. I could as well use a plain old JSON=
 object property
whose value is the URI instead of having to put it into a =
special "_links"
property.

So, how is HAL e.g. different from using POX wi=
th Atom's link element?



--
Markus Lanthaler
